titles.title: Financial Markets Reassurance Act of 1998
To limit the authority of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to alter the regulation of certain hybrid instruments and swap agreements under the Commodity Exchange Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Risk Management and Specialty Crops.

bill.summary: 8/6/1998--Introduced. Financial Markets Reassurance Act of 1998 - Prohibits, with specified exceptions, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission from proposing or issuing any rule or regulation that restricts or regulates activity in a qualifying hybrid instrument or swap agreement during a specified time period.
